abstract.p: This document specifies the use of ISO 10303 integrated resources satisfying the requirements for providing text and symbology applied to either a drawing sheet, drawing view, a piece of annotation, or a draughting shape model, for the purpose of communicating product data and drawing interpretation information.

purpose.p: This document specifies the application interpreted construct for the description of annotation presented on a drawing that has a specific meaning or purpose within the scope of draughting. Annotation, in the form of text and symbology, provides additional product data that may be needed to fully define the product or interpret the drawing.
The second edition of this part of ISO 10303 incorporates modifications that are upwardly compatible with the first edition. Modifications to EXPRESS specifications are upwardly compatible if:

ul.li: the mapping tables of ISO 10303 application protocols based on the previous edition of this part of ISO 10303 remain valid in a revision of that application protocol based on this edition of this part of ISO 10303.

purpose.p: Technical modifications to the first edition of this part of ISO 10303 are categorised as follows: changes to the EXPRESS declarations, new EXPRESS declarations, and changes to definitions of EXPRESS entity data types.
The following aic_draughting_annotation EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been modified:

scope.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies the interpretation of the integrated resources to satisfy requirements for the definition of annotation for the purpose of communicating product data and drawing interpretation information.
The following are within the scope of this part of ISO 10303:

ul.li: the presentation of non-shape product data depicted by two-dimensional or planar three-dimensional annotation;
the structures for representing the presentation characteristics of annotation;
the structures for representing subfigures and symbols;
the structures for representing externally defined symbols and presentation characteristics;

outscope.li: annotation that presents a dimension or draughting callout.
